parameters.content: Get the non-comment changes for recent items, note Init contains minute value
Also get the comment changes for recent items, note filter contains minute value
Identify linked issues to those which have been updated and add them to the list
are you a watcher of an item that hasn't been updated, but was linked to an item that was?
Categorize the information to be fed to the user.

Distribute the information to the user. Potentially integrate a feedback loop so that users can ensure they aren't bothered by the same item multiple times in the case of suggestions like "would you like to make yourself a watcher on this item?"
Are you a watcher, assigneee or reporter of an item that was actually updated?
Keep everything in the top that doesn't have a match in the bottom

get the full liost of issues by key. Then for each issue, construct the information JSON (so all field updates back in a field umbrella, and all comment updates in the comment umbrella). Eac hlist ordered by change ascending.

parameters.text:
=You are an IT support assistant at VIPR.

Given this JSON, write ONE status digest email that summarizes every issue in LinkedIssues.

JSON:
{{ JSON.stringify($json.LinkedIssues, null, 2) }}

Instructions:
- For each LinkedIssues entry, include a short section:
  - Issue key
  - Key field changes (bulleted)
  - All comments, with the name of the commenter, the timestamp for the comment, and the wording on the comment (bulleted)
- Keep it professional.
- Make sure all timestamps, including the subject and body, are in the format dd/MM/yyyy, hh:mm.
Return JSON:
{
  "subject": "VIPR ticket updates {{ $now }}",
  "body": "..."
}

parameters.jsCode:
const emailObj = JSON.parse($json.output);
return [{ json: emailObj }];

const emailObj = JSON.parse($json.output);
return [{ json: emailObj }];
